page.title: 20 NATURAL HISTORY
page.content: In Spring the unimproved pastures are well covered with Cowslips. The Summer flowers are Poppies, Cornflowers, Campion and Buttercups. The land surrounding the Coombe Hill Canal is renowned for its variety of butterflies. The most common tree in the wetland is the Willow, most of which are pollarded for fence posts. There are also 2 lots of{withy beds} which supply the raw materials for basket making. The canal is leased by the GLOUCESTERSHIRE TRUST FOR NATURE CONSERVATION and Dragonfly and Damselfly breed in profusion. Wild Flags are increasingly colonising the silted margins of the canal. M.GREENING.
